author: Special Correspondent
text:
The City Corporation has handed over maintenance of Sadayampalayam tank to Olirum Erodu Foundation in Erode.- PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

The Olirum Erodu Foundation was given the official order by the City Corporation on Wednesday for maintaining the Sadayampalayam tank that has been beautified and commissioned for public use.

Recreation zone

The deepened tank with walking pavements draws walkers every day. The Corporation had transformed the tank into a recreation zone at a cost of Rs. 2.5 crore a year ago.

The Corporation had completed the work on deepening and beautification at a cost of Rs. 2.5 crore, a year ago, with Infrastructure Gap Filling Fund sanctioned by the State Government.

The water body on a seven-acre spread that receives substantial water during rainy season recharges aquifer with 50 recharge wells dug to a depth of 100 feet.

The Foundation intends to put up fencing, raise trees, set right the solar lighting, and create greenery wherever possible, besides putting up concrete benches.

A security guard will be posted on a permanent basis for safeguarding the greenery, the Foundation’s chief executive officer Chandrasekar said.

The City Corporation, sources said, has plans to develop tanks in a similar manner at Kasipalayam, Karuvilparaivalasu and a few other places and hand them over to welfare organisations for maintenance.
title: Olirum Erodu Foundation takes over maintenance of Sadayampalayam tank
